title: Look inside Manchester's luxury new sports bar The Director's Box
text:
Look inside Manchester's luxury new sports bar The Director's Box The old Beef & Pudding site has been transformed into a high-end sports hub Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
The Director's Box opens in Manchester today, on a mission to bring a high-end sports bar to the city centre. 
Based on Booth Street in the old Beef & Pudding site, co-director Rachelle Stringer - owner of The Vine pub across the road - has big plans for the space. 
No expense has been spared on the 4K and HD TVs, which line the walls and are a combination of Sky Q, BT Sport, and Freeview. 
The large number of screens means that The Director's Box can show up to four different games at one time, and customers are invited to request their favourite match ahead of their visit. (Photo: Eddie Garvey) 
But it's not just football that'll be on the big screens; golf, darts, formula one, cricket, and tennis will also be shown. The bar will be screening American Football, starting with the Super Bowl on Sunday, February 5. 
Visitors will be able to take a seat at the long wooden tables, or watch the game from cosy booths which feature a convenient bell for drinks service. Read More Manchester's first easyHotel reveals opening date (Photo: Eddie Garvey) 
The bar is well stocked with classic beers on tap and draught, while fridges feature a range of ciders and craft beers. Five different types of prosecco are on hand to toast to the winning team, while a large gin selection includes small batch distillers such as The Original Manchester Gin. (Photo: Eddie Garvey) 
In the future, the team will develop an American-inspired menu with large sharing plates, but there will also be some high-end dishes and salads available. (Photo: Eddie Garvey) 
Another plan is to introduce an optional membership card. While membership will not be necessary to enter the bar all the time, members will get priority during big games, which staff say will enable them to control the numbers during busy periods. 
The Director's Box will be open for a soft launch from today, and will throw an official launch party next month, once they're settled into their new space. Read More
